TITLE: As Beijing Takes Control, Chinese Tech Companies Lose Jobs and Hope
SUMMARY: The crackdown is killing the entrepreneurial drive that made China a tech power and destroying jobs that used to attract the country’s brightest.

TITLE: Organic Milk Farmers in Northeast Under Pressure as Processors Look West
SUMMARY: Organic milk has been a lifeline for small farms in Maine and other New England states. Now those farms are facing trouble as milk processors look to huge dairies in Western states.

TITLE: Sara Menker and Gro Intelligence Are Tackling Global Hunger
SUMMARY: The Ethiopian entrepreneur Sara Menker founded Gro Intelligence, which uses artificial intelligence to forecast global agricultural trends and battle food insecurity.

TITLE: What It Was Like on the Elizabeth Holmes Jury for 18 Weeks
SUMMARY: Away from the media frenzy, jurors dealt with the trial’s disruption to their lives and had little idea of the case’s implications.

TITLE: Facebook Rejected Ads From 60 Women's Sexual Health Companies According to New Report
SUMMARY: A new report found that the social network has rejected ads from 60 companies focused on women’s sexual health, citing policies on “adult products and services.”

TITLE: Tech Start-Ups Reach a New Peak of Froth
SUMMARY: There’s more money and more bubbly behavior. Investors insist it’s rational.

TITLE: What Elizabeth Holmes and Theranos Reveal About Venture Capitalism
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley’s big investors are not like the rest of us.

TITLE: Ambitions and Emotions Run Hot in ‘The Founders,’ a History of PayPal
SUMMARY: Jimmy Soni’s book tells the story of how an ensemble of entrepreneurs, including Elon Musk and Peter Thiel, helped the online payment system prevail.

TITLE: Glimpses of Northern India’s Vanishing Nomads
SUMMARY: For centuries, Kharnak nomads have raised livestock in one of the most hauntingly beautiful — and inhospitable — places on earth. Can their traditions outlast a generational exodus?

TITLE: Running a Business Under the Shadow of War
SUMMARY: “When you’re constantly thinking about invading Russians you’re not going to go buy a new phone, or a car, or a house.”

TITLE: More Brew and Less Buzz, With Low-Alcohol Beers
SUMMARY: While all the attention goes to the extremes — strong ales and alcohol-free beers — craft brewers are increasingly aiming for the sweet spot in the middle.

TITLE: Hollywood Bets Big on the Bad Entrepreneur
SUMMARY: With limited series like “The Dropout,” “WeCrashed” and “Super Pumped,” the culture is saturated with ripped-from-the-headlines tales of self-immolating moguls.

TITLE: You Quit Your Job, but You Still Need a Retirement Plan
SUMMARY: Millions of American workers said goodbye to their bosses last year. If you’re one, don’t lose sight of your savings and investment goals.

TITLE: Female Entrepreneurs Who Confront a Particular Kind of Troll
SUMMARY: Food companies founded by Asian American women find social media engagement with customers helps their growth, but they also face racist and sexist comments.

TITLE: Friends With Benefits Social Club Runs On Crypto and Vibes
SUMMARY: Friends With Benefits is a V.I.P. lounge for crypto’s creative class. Is it empty hype or the future of friendship?

TITLE: Anonymity in Crypto Raises Alarm
SUMMARY: Investors give money to pseudonymous developers. Venture capitalists back founders without learning their real names. What happens when they need to know?

TITLE: A Spotlight on Tech’s Invisible Start-ups
SUMMARY: A new how-to guide aims to support the start-ups that are chugging along and doing just fine.

TITLE: In Detroit, a Bet That Healthy Restaurants Can Help the City
SUMMARY: For years, a coalition of groups has supported food businesses, seeing them as critical to the city’s continuing recovery. The pandemic has put its accomplishments to the test.

TITLE: Nightlife Inflation: Why Drink Prices and Entrance Fees are going up
SUMMARY: Surging prices are taking a toll on a night on the town. “I remember just going ‘yikes’ when signing off on a nearly $80 bill,” a bar patron said.

TITLE: New Yorkers With Marijuana Convictions Will Get First Retail Licenses
SUMMARY: Officials intend to reserve the first 100 or more retail licenses to sell marijuana in New York for people who have been convicted of related offenses, or their relatives.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes’s Ex-Boyfriend Set to Go on Trial in Theranos Case
SUMMARY: Jury selection started in Sunny Balwani’s fraud trial, which will establish just how much he knew about the blood-testing start-up Theranos and Ms. Holmes’s actions.

TITLE: Oakland Cannabis Sellers, Once Full of Hope, Face a Harsh Reality
SUMMARY: The cannabis industry, designed in part to help communities upended by the war on drugs, is being threatened by theft, racism and a market that is stacked against small operators.

TITLE: How Instagram’s Algorithm Change Is Hurting Small Businesses
SUMMARY: Instagram’s choice to prioritize videos over photos creates unforeseen costs for small companies, leaving many owners disheartened.

TITLE: Tech Start-Up Aims to Get Artists Royalties for Resale
SUMMARY: Fairchain generates digital contracts and certificates of title and authenticity, allowing artists to track their work and share in secondary market proceeds.

TITLE: Online Brands Try a Traditional Marketing Strategy: Physical Stores
SUMMARY: As digital advertising costs rise, more direct-to-consumer retailers are opening shops, leasing turnkey options or securing short-term spaces in other stores.

TITLE: Restaurants Rethink Gender’s Role in Service
SUMMARY: A dinner out can be discomforting for nonbinary and transgender people. But efforts are afoot to change that.

TITLE: Entrepreneurship Is Alive in N.Y. Public Housing. Will the City Step Up?
SUMMARY: A new report urges officials to support New York City’s most vulnerable business owners, at a time when jobs lost to the pandemic may take years to return.

TITLE: Forlini’s Italian Restaurant Closes
SUMMARY: The beloved red-sauce restaurant in New York’s Chinatown has served its last clams casino. “It’s hard, but we’re leaving while we’re still on top,” Derek Forlini said.

TITLE: ‘La French Tech’ Arrives Under Macron, but Proves No Panacea
SUMMARY: The president has brought innovation, jobs and growth. Still, resentments fester on the eve of the presidential election.

TITLE: Legal Marijuana Sales Expected to Start Within Weeks in New Jersey
SUMMARY: A state commission has granted seven medical-marijuana companies permission to start selling cannabis to all adults at 13 dispensaries.

TITLE: Jordan Belfort, Still the Wolf, Likes Crypto Now
SUMMARY: Jordan Belfort, the inspiration for “The Wolf of Wall Street,” is marketing himself as a cryptocurrency guru.

TITLE: In Venice, a Young Boatman Steers a Course of His Own
SUMMARY: “What I ask myself all the time is, ‘What is a man?’” says Edoardo Beniamin, a trans man training to join his father’s profession as a gondolier.

TITLE: Afghan Restaurateurs Provide Hope to Refugees Fleeing the Taliban
SUMMARY: In Virginia, Maryland and Washington, D.C., established Afghan restaurateurs are reaching out to help refugees fleeing the return of the Taliban.

TITLE: To Tip, or Not to Tip?
SUMMARY: Automated payment and the spread of tipping to every corner of the food-service business have helped workers weather the pandemic. But some consumers feel overwhelmed.

TITLE: Umang Gupta, Who Paved Way for Indian Tech Executives, Dies at 73
SUMMARY: He found success as an entrepreneur in Silicon Valley shortly after arriving there in 1978, then represented his fellow alumni from the Indian Institutes of Technology.

TITLE: ‘El lobo de Wall Street’ ahora dice que es un gurú de las criptomonedas
SUMMARY: Jordan Belfort, el hombre que inspiró la película protagonizada por Leonardo DiCaprio, ahora se promociona como un experto en el mundo de las criptomonedas.

TITLE: Vietnamese Restaurants Reach for Fast-Food Success
SUMMARY: From a former KFC to a 1950s-style drive-in, owners see the quick-service window as a portal to a wider audience.

TITLE: A New York Bagel From an Unexpected Borough: Connecticut
SUMMARY: Popupbagels drives its suburban versions into a city with very fixed ideas of what makes a bagel. It’s a daring move, but it’s paying off.

TITLE: How Elon Musk Winged It With Twitter, and Everything Else
SUMMARY: To a degree unseen in any other mogul, the world’s richest man acts on impulse and the belief that he is absolutely right.

TITLE: Bolt Built $11 Billion Business With Inflated Metrics and Eager Investors
SUMMARY: The start-up has had a meteoric rise, thanks to its charismatic co-founder, Ryan Breslow. But he sometimes stretched the truth to get there.

TITLE: For Tens of Millions of Americans, the Good Times Are Right Now
SUMMARY: Their houses are piggy banks, their retirement accounts are up and their bosses are eager to please. When the boom ends, everything will change.

TITLE: Fear and Loathing Return to Tech Start-Ups
SUMMARY: Workers are dumping their stock, companies are cutting costs, and layoffs abound as troubling economic forces hit tech start-ups.

TITLE: ‘Legacy’ Pot Dealers in New York Want to Go Legal. Can They?
SUMMARY: For “legacy” cannabis entrepreneurs, becoming a taxpaying, regulation-observing business has its challenges.

TITLE: How a Trash-Talking Crypto Founder Caused a $40 Billion Crash
SUMMARY: Do Kwon, a South Korean entrepreneur, hyped the Luna and TerraUSD cryptocurrencies. Their failures have devastated some traders, though not the investment firms that cashed out early.

TITLE: It’s Emma Rogue’s Downtown Now
SUMMARY: The clothing seller is building a vibrant and eclectic community of TikTok style stars, D.I.Y. designers and vintage fanatics.

TITLE: Missoula’s Most In-Demand Kitchen Is Run by Refugees
SUMMARY: With meals often sold out in minutes, United We Eat @Home is transforming how local residents eat and how refugees support themselves.

TITLE: A Road Trip Explores Pennsylvania’s Rye Whiskey
SUMMARY: Old Monongahela rye is having a comeback. A distillery road trip tells the story of its fall and rise, with Alexander Hamilton playing the villain.

TITLE: A Tennessee Deli Nurtures Its Ties to Ukraine
SUMMARY: A couple opened Potchke, a pop-up in Knoxville, to showcase their love of the war-ravaged country and its cooking.

TITLE: 400 Years Ago, They Would Be Witches. Today, They Can Be Your Coach.
SUMMARY: As more and more Americans call themselves spiritual but not religious, spiritual coaches give us a glimpse of the allure and the hazards of 21st-century D.I.Y. religion.

TITLE: New York’s Weed Rush Is Here. They Came to Cash In.
SUMMARY: For generations, entrepreneurs and dreamers have moved to New York City to strike it big. Now they’re coming to sell a lot of cannabis.
